@roblox/global/game.HttpGet.documentation: Performs an HTTP GET request to the given URL and returns the response body.
@roblox/global/game.HttpGet.code_sample:
-- Basic GET
local body = game:HttpGet("https://httpbin.org/get")
print(string.sub(body, 1, 60) .. "...")

-- With flags (executor-specific behavior may vary)
local body2 = game:HttpGet(
    "https://httpbin.org/anything",
    true, -- synchronous (yield until finished)
    Enum.HttpRequestType.Default,
    false -- doNotAllowDiabolicalMode
)
print(#body2)

params.name: url
params.documentation: The absolute URL to request (e.g., https://example.com/path)

params.name: synchronous
params.documentation: If true (or omitted), the call yields until completion; if false, behavior is executor-specific

params.name: httpRequestType
params.documentation: A hint for classifying the request (e.g., Enum.HttpRequestType.Default)

params.name: doNotAllowDiabolicalMode
params.documentation: Advanced flag; when true, disables special/internal request modes if supported

@roblox/global/game.HttpGetAsync.documentation: Performs an HTTP GET request to the given URL and returns the response body. Despite the name, most implementations yield until the request completes.

params.name: url
params.documentation: The absolute URL to request (e.g., https://example.com/path)

params.name: httpRequestType
params.documentation: A hint for classifying the request (e.g., Enum.HttpRequestType.Default)

@roblox/global/cache.documentation: The cache library provides methods for modifying the internal Instance cache.

@roblox/global/cache.iscached.documentation: Checks whether `object` exists in the [Instance] cache.
@roblox/global/cache.iscached.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
cache.invalidate(Lighting)
print(cache.iscached(Lighting)) --> false

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object to find.

@roblox/global/cache.invalidate.documentation: Deletes `object` from the [Instance] cache. Effectively invalidates `object` as a reference to the underlying Instance.
@roblox/global/cache.invalidate.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
cache.invalidate(game:GetService("Lighting"))
print(Lighting, Lighting == game:GetService("Lighting")) --> Lighting, false

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object to invalidate.

@roblox/global/cache.replace.code_sample:
local Lighting = game:GetService("Lighting")
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

cache.replace(Lighting, Players)

print(Lighting) --> Players

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object to replace.

params.name: newObject
params.documentation: The new object to replace `object` with.

@roblox/global/checkcaller.documentation: Determines whether the function was called from the executor's thread.
@roblox/global/checkcaller.code_sample:
-- Function to demonstrate checkcaller
local function testCaller()
	print("Called from executor thread:", checkcaller())
end

-- Call from executor thread
testCaller() -- Output: Called from executor thread: true

-- Create a dummy event
local bindable = Instance.new("BindableEvent")
bindable.Event:Connect(testCaller) -- This will call from a Roblox thread
bindable:Fire() -- Output: Called from executor thread: false

@roblox/global/clonefunction.documentation: Creates and returns a new function that has the same behaviour as the passed function.
@roblox/global/clonefunction.code_sample:
local function DummyFunction()
	print("Hello")
end

local ClonedFunction = clonefunction(DummyFunction)

print(debug.info(ClonedFunction, "l")) -- Output: 1
print(debug.info(ClonedFunction, "n")) -- Output: DummyFunction
print(ClonedFunction == DummyFunction) -- Output: false
print(getfenv(ClonedFunction) == getfenv(DummyFunction)) -- Output: true

params.name: function_to_clone
params.documentation: The function to clone.

@roblox/global/getfunctionhash.documentation: Returns the hex-represented SHA-384 hash of a provided function's instructions (code) and constants.
@roblox/global/getfunctionhash.code_sample:
local function isSHA384Hex(hash)
	if #hash ~= 96 then
		return false
	end
	if not hash:match("^[0-9a-fA-F]+$") then
		return false
	end
	return true
end

local DummyFunction0 = function() end
local DummyFunction1 = function(...) end
local DummyFunction2 = function() end
local DummyFunction3 = function() return "Constant" end
local DummyFunction4 = function() return "Constant2" end

print(isSHA384Hex(getfunctionhash(DummyFunction0))) -- Output: true
print(getfunctionhash(DummyFunction0) == getfunctionhash(DummyFunction1)) -- Output: false
print(getfunctionhash(DummyFunction0) == getfunctionhash(DummyFunction2)) -- Output: true
print(getfunctionhash(DummyFunction3) == getfunctionhash(DummyFunction4)) -- Output: false

params.name: function_to_hash
params.documentation: The function whose hash is to be computed.

@roblox/global/hookfunction.documentation: Hooks a function with another wanted function, returning the original unhooked function.
@roblox/global/hookfunction.code_sample:
local function DummyFunction()
	print("I am not hooked!")
end

local function DummyHook()
	print("I am hooked!")
end

DummyFunction() -- Output: I am not hooked!

local OldFunction = hookfunction(DummyFunction, DummyHook)

DummyFunction() -- Output: I am hooked!
OldFunction() -- Output: I am not hooked!

params.name: function_to_hook
params.documentation: The function that will be hooked

params.name: hook
params.documentation: The function that will be used as a hook

@roblox/global/hookmetamethod.documentation: Takes any lua value that can have metatable and attempts to hook the specified metamethod of the lua value with the hookfunction function.
@roblox/global/hookmetamethod.code_sample:
local Original; Original = hookmetamethod(game, "__index", function(...)
	local Key = select(2, ...)
	print(Key)
	return Original(...)
end)

local _ = game.PlaceId
hookmetamethod(game, "__index", Original) -- Restores game's __index

-- Output: PlaceId

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object which has the metatable.

params.name: metamethod_name
params.documentation: The name of the metamethod to hook.

params.name: hook
params.documentation: The function that will be used as a hook.

@roblox/global/iscclosure.documentation: Checks if the given function is a C closure.
@roblox/global/iscclosure.code_sample:
local function DummyLuaFunction()
	print("This is an executor Lua closure")
end

local DummyCFunction = newcclosure(function()
	print("This is an Executor C Closure")
end)

local DummyStandardCFunction = print
local DummyGlobalCFunction = getgc

print(iscclosure(DummyCFunction)) -- Output: true
print(iscclosure(DummyGlobalCFunction)) -- Output: true
print(iscclosure(DummyStandardCFunction)) -- Output: true
print(iscclosure(DummyLuaFunction)) -- Output: false

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to check.

@roblox/global/isexecutorclosure.documentation: Checks if a given function is the executor's closure.
@roblox/global/isexecutorclosure.code_sample:
local function DummyLuaFunction()
	print("This is an executor Lua closure")
end

local DummyCFunction = newcclosure(function()
	print("This is an executor C closure")
end)

local DummyStandardCFunction = print
local DummyGlobalCFunction = getgc

print(isexecutorclosure(DummyLuaFunction)) -- Output: true
print(isexecutorclosure(DummyCFunction)) -- Output: true
print(isexecutorclosure(DummyGlobalCFunction)) -- Output: true
print(isexecutorclosure(DummyStandardCFunction)) -- Output: false

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to check.

@roblox/global/islclosure.documentation: Checks if a given function is a L closure.
@roblox/global/islclosure.code_sample:
local function DummyLuaFunction()
	print("This is an executor Lua closure")
end

local DummyCFunction = newcclosure(function()
	print("This is an executor C closure")
end)

local DummyStandardCFunction = print

print(islclosure(DummyLuaFunction)) -- Output: true
print(islclosure(DummyStandardCFunction)) -- Output: false
print(islclosure(DummyCFunction)) -- Output: false

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to check.

@roblox/global/newcclosure.documentation: This function takes in a function and wraps it into a C closure.
@roblox/global/newcclosure.code_sample:
local DummyFunction = function(...)
	return ...
end

print(iscclosure(DummyFunction)) -- Output: false

local WrappedFunction = newcclosure(DummyFunction)

print(iscclosure(WrappedFunction)) -- Output: true

local FunctionResults = WrappedFunction("Hello")
print(FunctionResults) -- Output: Hello

params.name: function_to_wrap
params.documentation: A function to be wrapped.

@roblox/global/restorefunction.documentation: Restores a function that was previously hooked back to its original implementation.

params.name: functionToRestore
params.documentation: The function to restore to its original, unhooked state

@roblox/global/getnamecallmethod.documentation: Returns the current `__namecall` method name inside a namecall hook.
@roblox/global/getnamecallmethod.code_sample:
local old; old = hookmetamethod(game, "__namecall", function(self, ...)
    local method = getnamecallmethod()
    if method == "FireServer" then
        print("Intercepted FireServer")
    end
    return old(self, ...)
end)

@roblox/global/rconsoleclear.documentation: Clears the output of the console window.
@roblox/global/rconsoleclear.code_sample:
-- Create the console window
rconsolesettitle("New console")
rconsoleprint("Hello, world!")
rconsolecreate()

-- Clears the output "Hello, world!"
rconsoleclear()

@roblox/global/rconsolecreate.documentation: Opens the console window. Text previously output to the console will not be cleared.
@roblox/global/rconsolecreate.code_sample:
-- Create the console window
rconsolesettitle("Beautiful Mountains")
rconsolecreate()

local function generate()
	-- Generate a random decimal number for noise
	local seed = math.random(100, 999) + math.random()

	-- Prints 25 lines of text
	for i = 1, 25 do
		local noise = math.noise(i / 8, seed) + 0.5
		local height = math.floor(noise * 50)
		local line = string.rep("*", height)
		rconsoleprint(line .. "
")
	end

	-- Prompts the user to generate a new set of mountains
	-- or exit the console window
	rconsoleprint("
Enter 'Y' to generate a new landscape, or nothing to exit
")

	local input = rconsoleinput()

	if string.lower(input) == "y" then
		rconsoleclear()
		generate()
	else
		rconsoledestroy()
	end
end

generate()

@roblox/global/rconsoledestroy.documentation: Closes the console window and clears its output. The title will not be changed.
@roblox/global/rconsoledestroy.code_sample:
-- Create a console window titled "New console" and with the output "Hello, world!"
rconsolesettitle("New console")
rconsoleprint("Hello, world!")
rconsolecreate()

-- Close the console window, clearing its output
rconsoledestroy()

-- Reopen the console window titled "New console" with no output
rconsolecreate()

@roblox/global/rconsoleinput.documentation: Waits for the user to input text into the console window. Returns the result.
@roblox/global/rconsoleinput.code_sample:
-- Create the console window
rconsolesettitle("Your Info")
rconsoleprint("What is your name?
My name is: ")
rconsolecreate()

-- Retrieve the user's input
local name = rconsoleinput()
rconsoleprint("Hello, " .. name .. "!")

-- Cleanup
task.wait(1)
rconsoledestroy()

@roblox/global/rconsoleprint.documentation: Prints `text` to the console window. Does not clear existing text or create a new line.
@roblox/global/rconsoleprint.code_sample:
-- Create a console window titled "New console" with the
-- output "Hello, world!! How are you today?"
rconsolesettitle("New console")
rconsoleprint("Hello, world!")
rconsoleprint("! How are you today?")
rconsolecreate()

params.name: text
params.documentation: The text to write to the console.

@roblox/global/rconsolesettitle.documentation: Sets the title of the console window to `title`.
@roblox/global/rconsolesettitle.code_sample:
-- Create a console window titled "My console"
rconsolesettitle("My console")
rconsolecreate()

params.name: title
params.documentation: The window title text.

@roblox/global/crypt.documentation: Functions made for encrypting and decrypting data.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64decode.documentation: Decodes a Base64 string into its original form.
@roblox/global/crypt.base64decode.code_sample:
local bytecode = game:HttpGet("https://rubis-api.numelon.com/v2/scrap/zuxQZuM9Tnl5MRbo/raw")
writefile("sound.mp3", crypt.base64decode(bytecode)) -- This file should be a valid and working mp3 file.

params.name: data
params.documentation: The data to decode.

@roblox/global/crypt.base64encode.documentation: Encodes a string into Base64 format.

params.name: data
params.documentation: The data to encode.

@roblox/global/crypt.encrypt.documentation: Encrypts an unencoded string using AES encryption. Returns the base64 encoded and encrypted string, and the IV. If an AES IV is not provided, a random one will be generated for you, and returned as a 2nd base64 encoded string. The cipher mode default is `CBC`.

params.name: data
params.documentation: The unencoded content.

params.name: key
params.documentation: A base64 256-bit key.

params.name: iv
params.documentation: Optional base64 AES initialization vector.

params.name: mode
params.documentation: The AES cipher mode.

@roblox/global/crypt.decrypt.documentation: Decrypts the base64 encoded and encrypted content. Returns the raw string.

params.name: data
params.documentation: The unencoded content.

params.name: key
params.documentation: A base64 256-bit key.

params.name: iv
params.documentation: The base64 AES initialization vector.

params.name: mode
params.documentation: The AES cipher mode.

@roblox/global/crypt.generatebytes.documentation: Generates a random sequence of bytes of the given size. Returns the sequence as a base64 encoded string.
@roblox/global/crypt.generatebytes.code_sample:
local bytes = crypt.generatebytes(16)
print(bytes) --> bXlzcWwgYm9vbGVhbnM=
print(#crypt.base64decode(bytes)) --> 16

params.name: size
params.documentation: The number of bytes to generate.

@roblox/global/crypt.generatekey.documentation: Generates a base64 encoded 256-bit key. The result can be used as the second parameter for the [crypt.encrypt] and [crypt.decrypt] functions.

@roblox/global/crypt.hash.documentation: Returns the result of hashing the data using the given algorithm.

params.name: data
params.documentation: The unencoded content.

params.name: algorithm
params.documentation: A hash algorithm.

@luau/global/debug.getconstant.documentation: Returns the constant at the specified index. If there is no constant at that index, `nil` is returned.
@luau/global/debug.getconstant.code_sample:
local function DummyFunction()
	return "Hello"
end

local Constant = debug.getconstant(DummyFunction, 1)
print(Constant) -- Output: Hello

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The Lua function/level from which the constant is obtained

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position of the desired constant

@luau/global/debug.getconstants.documentation: Returns the constants of the specified Lua function.
@luau/global/debug.getconstants.code_sample:
local function DummyFunction()
	return "Hello"
end

local Constants = debug.getconstants(DummyFunction)
print(Constants[1]) -- Output: Hello

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The Lua function/level from which the constants are obtained

@luau/global/debug.getproto.documentation: Returns the proto at the specified index. If the third argument is `true`, returns a table containing the active functions of the proto.
@luau/global/debug.getproto.code_sample:
local function OuterFunction()
	local function InnerFunction1()
		return "Inner1"
	end
	local function InnerFunction2()
		return "Inner2"
	end
	return InnerFunction1() .. InnerFunction2()
end

local Proto = debug.getproto(OuterFunction, 1)
print(Proto()) -- Output: Inner1

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The function from which to obtain the proto

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position of the proto

params.name: activated
params.documentation: Whether to search the GC for the active function of the proto

@luau/global/debug.getprotos.documentation: Returns all the functions (protos) defined within the given Lua function.
@luau/global/debug.getprotos.code_sample:
local function OuterFunction()
	local function InnerFunction1()
		return "Inner1"
	end
	local function InnerFunction2()
		return "Inner2"
	end
	return InnerFunction1() .. InnerFunction2()
end

local Protos = debug.getprotos(OuterFunction)
print("Number of inner functions:", #Protos) -- Output: Number of inner functions: 2

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The function from which the protos are obtained

@luau/global/debug.getstack.documentation: Returns all values used in the call stack of the provided level. If index is given, returns the value at that position inside the stack frame.
@luau/global/debug.getstack.code_sample:
local function InnerFunction()
	local StackValues = debug.getstack(2)
	for i, v in ipairs(StackValues) do
		print(i, v)
	end
end

local function OuterFunction()
	local LocalVar = "OuterValue"
	InnerFunction()
end

OuterFunction()

params.name: level
params.documentation: The call stack level

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position within the stack frame

@luau/global/debug.getupvalue.documentation: Returns the upvalue at the specified index.
@luau/global/debug.getupvalue.code_sample:
local Prefix = "Value: "
local function DummyFunction(Value)
	return Prefix .. Value
end

local Upvalue = debug.getupvalue(DummyFunction, 1)
print(Upvalue) -- Output: Value:

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The Lua function/level from which the upvalue is obtained

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position of the desired upvalue

@luau/global/debug.getupvalues.documentation: Returns the upvalues of the specified Lua function.
@luau/global/debug.getupvalues.code_sample:
local Prefix = "Value: "
local function DummyFunction(Value)
	return Prefix .. Value
end

local Upvalues = debug.getupvalues(DummyFunction)
print(Upvalues[1]) -- Output: Value:

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The Lua function/level from which the upvalues are obtained

@luau/global/debug.setconstant.documentation: Sets the constant at the specified index in the given Lua function.
@luau/global/debug.setconstant.code_sample:
local function DummyFunction()
	return "Hello"
end

print(debug.getconstant(DummyFunction, 1)) -- Output: Hello
debug.setconstant(DummyFunction, 1, "Goodbye")
print(debug.getconstant(DummyFunction, 1)) -- Output: Goodbye

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The Lua function/level whose constant is to be set

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position of the constant

params.name: value
params.documentation: The new constant replacing the old one

@luau/global/debug.setstack.documentation: Sets a new value in the call stack at the specified level and index.
@luau/global/debug.setstack.code_sample:
local function InnerFunction()
	local Original = debug.getstack(2, 1)
	print("Original value:", Original)
	debug.setstack(2, 1, "Modified")
	local Modified = debug.getstack(2, 1)
	print("Modified value:", Modified)
end

local function OuterFunction()
	local LocalVar = "OuterValue"
	InnerFunction()
	print("Local variable after modification:", LocalVar)
end

OuterFunction()

params.name: level
params.documentation: The call stack level

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position within the stack frame

params.name: value
params.documentation: The new value to set

@luau/global/debug.setupvalue.documentation: Replaces the upvalue at the specified index in the given Lua function.
@luau/global/debug.setupvalue.code_sample:
local Prefix = "Value: "
local function DummyFunction(Value)
	return Prefix .. Value
end

print(DummyFunction("Hello")) -- Output: Value: Hello
debug.setupvalue(DummyFunction, 1, "Modified: ")
print(DummyFunction("Hello")) -- Output: Modified: Hello

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: The Lua function/level whose upvalue is to be set

params.name: index
params.documentation: The position of the desired upvalue

params.name: value
params.documentation: The new upvalue replacing the old one

@luau/global/debug.getinfo.documentation:
Returns debugger information about a function or stack level.

> ðŸª² Compatibility
> Some executors are missing certain fields.

### DebugInfo

| Field | Type | Description |
| ----- | ---- | ----------- |
| `source` | string | The name of the chunk that created the function. |
| `short_src` | string | A "printable" version of `source` to be used in error messages. |
| `func` | function | The function itself. |
| `what` | string | The string "Lua" if the function is a Luau function, or "C" if it is a C function. |
| `currentline` | number | The current line where the given function is executing. When no line information is available, `currentline` is set to -1. |
| `name` | string | The name of the function. If it cannot find a name, then `name` is a blank string. |
| `nups` | number | The number of upvalues in the function. |
| `numparams` | number | The number of parameters in the function (always 0 for C functions). |
| `is_vararg` | number | Whether the function has a variadic argument (1 if it does, 0 if it does not). |
@luau/global/debug.getinfo.code_sample:
local function foo()
	print("Hello, world!")
end

for k, v in pairs(debug.getinfo(foo)) do
	print(k, v, "(" .. type(v) .. ")")
end

params.name: func_or_level
params.documentation: A function or stack level.

@roblox/global/Drawing.documentation: The Drawing library provides an interface for rendering shapes and text onto the game window.

@roblox/global/Drawing.new.documentation: Creates a new drawing object of the specified type.
@roblox/global/Drawing.new.code_sample:
local Camera = game.Workspace.CurrentCamera
local Viewport = Camera.ViewportSize
local Position = Vector2.new(Viewport.X / 2, Viewport.Y / 2)

local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
circle.Radius = 50
circle.Color = Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0)
circle.Filled = true
circle.NumSides = 32
circle.Position = Position
circle.Transparency = 0.7
circle.Visible = true

task.wait(0.6)
circle:Destroy()

params.name: type
params.documentation: The type of drawing object to create. Can be "Line", "Text", "Image", "Circle", "Square", "Quad", or "Triangle".

@roblox/global/Drawing.Fonts.documentation: Contains font constants for use with [Text](https://github.com/sUNC-Utilities/Global-Functions-Documentation/blob/main/Libraries/Drawing.md#text) drawing objects.

@roblox/global/cleardrawcache.documentation: Destroys every drawing object in the cache, invalidating references to the drawing objects.
@roblox/global/cleardrawcache.code_sample:
local Camera = game.Workspace.CurrentCamera
local Viewport = Camera.ViewportSize
local Position = Vector2.new(Viewport.X / 2, Viewport.Y / 2)

local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
circle.Radius = 50
circle.Color = Color3.fromRGB(255, 0, 0)
circle.Filled = true
circle.NumSides = 1111
circle.Position = Position
circle.Transparency = 1
circle.Visible = true

task.defer(cleardrawcache)
print(circle.__OBJECT_EXISTS) -- Output: true
task.wait()
print(circle.__OBJECT_EXISTS) -- Output: false

@roblox/global/getrenderproperty.documentation: Gets the value of a drawing property, functionally similar to `drawing[property]`.
@roblox/global/getrenderproperty.code_sample:
local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
circle.Radius = 50
print(getrenderproperty(circle, "Radius")) -- Output: 50
print(getrenderproperty(circle, "Visible")) -- Output: false

params.name: drawing
params.documentation: The drawing object to get the property from.

params.name: property
params.documentation: The name of the property to get.

@roblox/global/isrenderobj.documentation: Returns whether `object` is a valid [Drawing](https://docs.sunc.su/Drawing) object.
@roblox/global/isrenderobj.code_sample:
print(isrenderobj(Drawing.new("Square"))) -- Output: true
print(isrenderobj(game)) -- Output: false

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object to check.

@roblox/global/setrenderproperty.documentation: Sets the value of a drawing property, functionally similar to `drawing[property] = value`.
@roblox/global/setrenderproperty.code_sample:
local circle = Drawing.new("Circle")
setrenderproperty(circle, "Radius", 50)
setrenderproperty(circle, "Visible", true)
print(circle.Radius) -- Output: 50
print(circle.Visible) -- Output: true

params.name: drawing
params.documentation: The drawing object to set the property on.

params.name: property
params.documentation: The name of the property to set.

params.name: value
params.documentation: The value to set the property to.

@roblox/global/getgc/overload/(false?) -.documentation: Returns a table with all collectible values that aren't dead (referenced by active scripts), excluding tables.
@roblox/global/getgc/overload/(false?) -.code_sample:
local gcWithoutTables = getgc()
print("Number of GC values (without tables):", #gcWithoutTables)

local gcWithTables = getgc(true)
print("Number of GC values (with tables):", #gcWithTables)

params.name: include_tables
params.documentation: Whether to include tables in the result (no)

@roblox/global/getgc/overload/(true) ->.documentation: Returns a table with all collectible values that aren't dead (referenced by active scripts), including tables.
@roblox/global/getgc/overload/(true) ->.code_sample:
local gcWithoutTables = getgc()
print("Number of GC values (without tables):", #gcWithoutTables)

local gcWithTables = getgc(true)
print("Number of GC values (with tables):", #gcWithTables)

params.name: include_tables
params.documentation: Whether to include tables in the result (yes)

@roblox/global/getgenv.documentation: Returns a table containing all executor functions, serving as the shared environment for all scripts executed by the executor.
@roblox/global/getgenv.code_sample:
local executorEnv = getgenv()
executorEnv.MyGlobalVariable = "This can be accessed from any script!"
print(getgenv().MyGlobalVariable) -- Output: This can be accessed from any script!

@roblox/global/getreg.documentation: Returns the Lua registry table for the current state.
@roblox/global/getreg.code_sample:
local registry = getreg()
print("Registry type:", type(registry)) -- Output: table

-- Show a few string-keyed entries
local shown = 0
for k, v in pairs(registry) do
    if type(k) == "string" then
        print(k, type(v))
        shown = shown + 1
        if shown >= 5 then break end
    end
end

@roblox/global/getrenv.documentation: Returns a table containing the Roblox environment.
@roblox/global/getrenv.code_sample:
local robloxEnv = getrenv()
print("Number of items in Roblox environment:", #robloxEnv) -- Output varies based on game

@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"tabl.documentation: Returns a table that matches the specified criteria, or `nil` if no match is found.
@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"tabl.code_sample:
-- Find a table with specific keys
local table = filtergc("table", { Keys = {"Players", "Settings"} }, true)
if table then
	print("Found matching table")
end

params.name: filter_type
params.documentation: The type of Lua value to search for ("table")

params.name: filter_options
params.documentation: Criteria used to filter the search results based on the specified type

params.name: return_one
params.documentation: If `true`, returns only the first match; otherwise, returns all matches

@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"tabl.documentation: Returns a table with all Lua tables that match the specified criteria.
@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"tabl.code_sample:
-- Find all tables with specific keys
local tables = filtergc("table", { Keys = {"Players", "Settings"} }, false)
print("Found", #tables, "tables")

params.name: filter_type
params.documentation: The type of Lua value to search for ("table")

params.name: filter_options
params.documentation: Criteria used to filter the search results based on the specified type

params.name: return_one
params.documentation: If `true`, returns only the first match; otherwise, returns all matches

@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"func.documentation: Returns a function that matches the specified criteria, or `nil` if no match is found.
@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"func.code_sample:
-- Find a function with a specific name
local function = filtergc("function", { Name = "UpdateClient" }, true)
if function then
	print("Found matching function")
end

params.name: filter_type
params.documentation: The type of Lua value to search for ("function")

params.name: filter_options
params.documentation: Criteria used to filter the search results based on the specified type

params.name: return_one
params.documentation: If `true`, returns only the first match; otherwise, returns all matches

@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"func.documentation: Returns a table with all Lua functions that match the specified criteria.
@roblox/global/filtergc/overload/(\"func.code_sample:
-- Find all functions with a specific name
local functions = filtergc("function", { Name = "UpdateClient" }, false)
print("Found", #functions, "functions")

params.name: filter_type
params.documentation: The type of Lua value to search for ("function")

params.name: filter_options
params.documentation: Criteria used to filter the search results based on the specified type

params.name: return_one
params.documentation: If `true`, returns only the first match; otherwise, returns all matches

@roblox/global/appendfile.documentation: Appends data to the end of the file at the specified path, creating the file if it doesn't already exist.
@roblox/global/appendfile.code_sample:
writefile("example.txt", "Hello")
appendfile("example.txt", " World!")

local content = readfile("example.txt")
print(content) -- Output: Hello World!

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file

params.name: contents
params.documentation: The content to append

@roblox/global/delfile.documentation: Deletes the file at the specified path.
@roblox/global/delfile.code_sample:
writefile("example.txt", "Hello")
print(isfile("example.txt")) -- Output: true

delfile("example.txt")
print(isfile("example.txt")) -- Output: false

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file

@roblox/global/delfolder.documentation: Deletes the folder at the specified path.
@roblox/global/delfolder.code_sample:
makefolder("examplefolder")
print(isfolder("examplefolder")) -- Output: true

delfolder("examplefolder")
print(isfolder("examplefolder")) -- Output: false

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the folder

@roblox/global/getcustomasset.documentation: Returns a content URL (e.g., rbxasset://) that can be used with UI elements, sounds, meshes, and more.
@roblox/global/getcustomasset.code_sample:
-- First, create or download an image file
writefile("image.png", game:HttpGet("https://example.com/image.png"))

-- Then use it in a UI element
local frame = Instance.new("Frame")
frame.Size = UDim2.new(0, 200, 0, 200)
frame.Position = UDim2.new(0.5, -100, 0.5, -100)
frame.Parent = game.CoreGui

local image = Instance.new("ImageLabel")
image.Size = UDim2.new(1, 0, 1, 0)
image.Image = getcustomasset("image.png")
image.Parent = frame

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file

@roblox/global/isfile.documentation: Determines if the specified path is a file.
@roblox/global/isfile.code_sample:
writefile("example.txt", "Hello")
makefolder("examplefolder")

print(isfile("example.txt")) -- Output: true
print(isfile("examplefolder")) -- Output: false
print(isfile("nonexistent.txt")) -- Output: false

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to check

@roblox/global/isfolder.documentation: Determines if the specified path is a folder.
@roblox/global/isfolder.code_sample:
makefolder("examplefolder")
writefile("example.txt", "Hello")

print(isfolder("examplefolder")) -- Output: true
print(isfolder("example.txt")) -- Output: false
print(isfolder("nonexistent")) -- Output: false

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to check

@roblox/global/listfiles.documentation: Provides a list of files and folders within a specified directory.
@roblox/global/listfiles.code_sample:
-- Create a folder and some files
makefolder("testfolder")
writefile("testfolder/file1.txt", "Hello")
writefile("testfolder/file2.txt", "World")

-- List the files
local files = listfiles("testfolder")
for _, file in ipairs(files) do
	print(file)
end
-- Output might be:
-- testfolder/file1.txt
-- testfolder/file2.txt

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the directory

@roblox/global/loadfile.documentation: Generates a chunk from the file at the given path, using the global environment. Returns the chunk or `nil` with an error message.
@roblox/global/loadfile.code_sample:
writefile("script.lua", "return function() print(\"Hello from loadfile!\") end")

local chunk = loadfile("script.lua")
if chunk then
	local func = chunk()
	func() -- Output: Hello from loadfile!
else
	print("Error loading file")
end

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file

@roblox/global/makefolder.documentation: Creates a folder at the specified path if it doesn't already exist.
@roblox/global/makefolder.code_sample:
makefolder("examplefolder")
print(isfolder("examplefolder")) -- Output: true

-- Create nested folders
makefolder("parent/child/grandchild")
print(isfolder("parent/child/grandchild")) -- Output: true

params.name: path
params.documentation: The location where you want to create the folder

@roblox/global/readfile.documentation: Retrieves the content of the file at the specified path.
@roblox/global/readfile.code_sample:
-- First create a file
writefile("example.txt", "Hello, world!")

-- Then read it
local content = readfile("example.txt")
print(content) -- Output: Hello, world!

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file that will be read

@roblox/global/writefile.documentation: Writes data to a specified file path.
@roblox/global/writefile.code_sample:
writefile("example.txt", "Hello, world!")
print("File created successfully!")

-- Read the file to verify
local content = readfile("example.txt")
print(content) -- Output: Hello, world!

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file that will be written to

params.name: data
params.documentation: The data to be written into the file

@roblox/global/dofile.documentation: Attempts to load the file located at `path` and execute it on a new thread.

params.name: path
params.documentation: The path to the file.

@roblox/global/cloneref.documentation: Returns a copy of the given Instance. The copy should not be equal to the original Instance.
@roblox/global/cloneref.code_sample:
local original = game.Workspace
local clone = cloneref(original)

print(original == clone) -- Output: false
print(compareinstances(original, clone)) -- Output: true
print(clone.Name) -- Output: Workspace

params.name: object
params.documentation: The Instance to clone

@roblox/global/compareinstances.documentation: Checks if two instances are equal. This is primarily used for comparing instances returned by [cloneref](https://docs.sunc.su/Instances/cloneref/) since the normal equality check may fail.
@roblox/global/compareinstances.code_sample:
local original = game.Workspace
local clone = cloneref(original)
local different = game.Players

print(original == clone) -- Output: false
print(compareinstances(original, clone)) -- Output: true
print(compareinstances(original, different)) -- Output: false

params.name: object1
params.documentation: The first Instance to compare

params.name: object2
params.documentation: The second Instance to compare

@roblox/global/fireclickdetector.documentation: Triggers a specified event on a [ClickDetector](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/classes/ClickDetector).
@roblox/global/fireclickdetector.code_sample:
-- Find a ClickDetector in the workspace
local function findClickDetector()
	for _, v in pairs(workspace:GetDescendants()) do
		if v:IsA("ClickDetector") then
			return v
		end
	end
	return nil
end

local clickDetector = findClickDetector()
if clickDetector then
	print("Found ClickDetector, firing...")
	fireclickdetector(clickDetector)
else
	print("No ClickDetector found")
end

params.name: object
params.documentation: The ClickDetector to trigger

params.name: distance
params.documentation: The distance from which to trigger the ClickDetector, defaults to math.huge

params.name: event
params.documentation: The event to trigger; defaults to MouseClick

@roblox/global/fireproximityprompt.documentation: Triggers a [ProximityPrompt](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/classes/ProximityPrompt) instantly, regardless of distance or duration.
@roblox/global/fireproximityprompt.code_sample:
-- Find a ProximityPrompt in the workspace
local function findProximityPrompt()
	for _, v in pairs(workspace:GetDescendants()) do
		if v:IsA("ProximityPrompt") then
			return v
		end
	end
	return nil
end

local proximityPrompt = findProximityPrompt()
if proximityPrompt then
	print("Found ProximityPrompt, firing...")
	fireproximityprompt(proximityPrompt)
else
	print("No ProximityPrompt found")
end

params.name: object
params.documentation: The ProximityPrompt to fire

@roblox/global/firetouchinterest.code_sample:
local part1 = Instance.new("Part")
part1.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part1.Anchored = true
part1.Parent = workspace

local part2 = Instance.new("Part")
part2.Position = Vector3.new(0, 5, 0)
part2.Anchored = true
part2.Parent = workspace

part2.Touched:Connect(function(hit)
	print("Touched by", hit.Name)
end)

-- Start touch
firetouchinterest(part1, part2, 0)
-- End touch after a short delay
task.wait(0.1)
firetouchinterest(part1, part2, 1)

params.name: part
params.documentation: The BasePart initiating the touch

params.name: part2
params.documentation: The BasePart to be touched

params.name: toggle
params.documentation: Determines whether to start (`false`/`0`) or end (`true`/`1`) the touch event

@roblox/global/getcallbackvalue.documentation: Returns the callback function assigned to an object's callback property. This function retrieves the underlying function that is otherwise inaccessible through normal indexing.
@roblox/global/getcallbackvalue.code_sample:
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Touched:Connect(function()
	print("Touched!")
end)

local touchedCallback = getcallbackvalue(part, "Touched")
if touchedCallback then
	print("Successfully retrieved callback!")
	-- You can now analyze or modify the callback
else
	print("Failed to retrieve callback")
end

params.name: object
params.documentation: The Instance from which to get the callback

params.name: property
params.documentation: The name of the callback property

@roblox/global/gethui.documentation: Returns a hidden UI container that minimizes detection. This container should not be directly discoverable via standard search methods.
@roblox/global/gethui.code_sample:
local container = gethui()

-- Create a UI element in the hidden container
local frame = Instance.new("Frame")
frame.Size = UDim2.new(0, 200, 0, 100)
frame.Position = UDim2.new(0.5, -100, 0.5, -50)
frame.BackgroundColor3 = Color3.fromRGB(50, 50, 50)
frame.Parent = container

local text = Instance.new("TextLabel")
text.Size = UDim2.new(1, 0, 1, 0)
text.Text = "Hidden UI"
text.TextColor3 = Color3.fromRGB(255, 255, 255)
text.Parent = frame

@roblox/global/getinstances.documentation: Returns a list of all instances referenced by the client.
@roblox/global/getinstances.code_sample:
local instances = getinstances()
print("Total instances:", #instances)

-- Count instances by class
local classCounts = {}
for _, instance in ipairs(instances) do
	local className = instance.ClassName
	classCounts[className] = (classCounts[className] or 0) + 1
end

-- Print the top 5 most common classes
local sortedClasses = {}
for class, count in pairs(classCounts) do
	table.insert(sortedClasses, {class = class, count = count})
end
table.sort(sortedClasses, function(a, b) return a.count > b.count end)

for i = 1, math.min(5, #sortedClasses) do
	print(sortedClasses[i].class, sortedClasses[i].count)
end

@roblox/global/getnilinstances.documentation: Returns a list of instances that have their Instance.Parent property set to `nil`.
@roblox/global/getnilinstances.code_sample:
local nilInstances = getnilinstances()
print("Total nil instances:", #nilInstances)

-- Count nil instances by class
local classCounts = {}
for _, instance in ipairs(nilInstances) do
	local className = instance.ClassName
	classCounts[className] = (classCounts[className] or 0) + 1
end

-- Print classes
for class, count in pairs(classCounts) do
	print(class, count)
end

@roblox/global/getrawmetatable.documentation: Returns the metatable of object, bypassing the `__metatable` field.

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object to get the metatable of

@roblox/global/isreadonly.documentation: Checks whether the provided table is read-only.
@roblox/global/isreadonly.code_sample:
local exampleTable = {value = 10}
print(isreadonly(exampleTable)) -- Output: false

-- Make the table read-only
setreadonly(exampleTable, true)
print(isreadonly(exampleTable)) -- Output: true

-- Make the table writable again
setreadonly(exampleTable, false)
print(isreadonly(exampleTable)) -- Output: false

params.name: table
params.documentation: The table to check

@roblox/global/setrawmetatable.documentation: Sets the metatable of object to the provided metatable, bypassing the `__metatable` field.

params.name: object
params.documentation: The object whose metatable is to be set

params.name: metatable
params.documentation: The metatable to set

@roblox/global/setreadonly.documentation: Sets the read-only state of the table to the provided boolean value, allowing or disallowing modifications.
@roblox/global/setreadonly.code_sample:
local exampleTable = {value = 10}

-- Make the table read-only
setreadonly(exampleTable, true)

-- This will error
pcall(function()
	exampleTable.value = 20
end)

-- Make the table writable again
setreadonly(exampleTable, false)

-- This will succeed
exampleTable.value = 20
print(exampleTable.value) -- Output: 20

params.name: table
params.documentation: The table to change the read-only state on

params.name: state
params.documentation: The desired read-only state

@roblox/global/identifyexecutor.documentation: Returns the name and version of the current executor.
@roblox/global/identifyexecutor.code_sample:
local executorName, executorVersion = identifyexecutor()
print("Running on", executorName, "version", executorVersion)

@roblox/global/request.documentation: Sends an HTTP request with the given options, yielding until the request is finished, and returns the response.

params.name: options
params.documentation: The options to use for the request

params.name: text
params.documentation: The text to copy.

@roblox/global/setfpscap.documentation: Sets a frame-rate cap for the client (executor-specific behavior).

params.name: fps
params.documentation: The FPS cap.

@roblox/global/gethiddenproperty.documentation: Returns the hidden, non-scriptable property's value regardless of its type, along with a boolean indicating if the property is hidden.
@roblox/global/gethiddenproperty.code_sample:
local part = Instance.new("Part")
local networkOwner, isHidden = gethiddenproperty(part, "NetworkOwner")
print("NetworkOwner:", networkOwner)
print("Is hidden property:", isHidden)

params.name: instance
params.documentation: The instance that contains the property

params.name: property_name
params.documentation: The name of the property to be read

@roblox/global/getthreadidentity.documentation: Retrieves the identity of the current thread.
@roblox/global/getthreadidentity.code_sample:
print("Current thread identity:", getthreadidentity())

-- Different identities have different permissions
-- Common values:
-- 0: System/highest privilege
-- 2: Regular game scripts
-- 7: Executor thread (common default)

@roblox/global/sethiddenproperty.documentation: Sets the hidden, non-scriptable property's value regardless of its type.
@roblox/global/sethiddenproperty.code_sample:
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Parent = workspace

-- Get the current value
local currentValue = gethiddenproperty(part, "NetworkIsSleeping")
print("Current value:", currentValue)

-- Set to the opposite value
local success = sethiddenproperty(part, "NetworkIsSleeping", not currentValue)
if success then
	print("Successfully changed property")
	print("New value:", gethiddenproperty(part, "NetworkIsSleeping"))
else
	print("Failed to change property")
end

params.name: instance
params.documentation: The instance that contains the property

params.name: property_name
params.documentation: The name of the property to assign

params.name: property_value
params.documentation: The value to set for the property

@roblox/global/setscriptable.documentation: Sets a hidden property to be scriptable so that it can be indexed as if it weren't hidden.
@roblox/global/setscriptable.code_sample:
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Parent = workspace

-- Try to access a hidden property (will error)
local success1, error1 = pcall(function()
	local value = part.NetworkIsSleeping
end)
print("Direct access:", success1 and "Succeeded" or "Failed: " .. error1)

-- Make the property scriptable
local result = setscriptable(part, "NetworkIsSleeping", true)
if result then
	-- Now try again
	local success2, result2 = pcall(function()
		local value = part.NetworkIsSleeping
		return value
	end)
	print("After setscriptable:", success2 and ("Succeeded: " .. tostring(result2)) or ("Failed: " .. result2))
else
	print("Failed to make property scriptable")
end

params.name: object
params.documentation: The instance whose property is to be modified

params.name: property
params.documentation: The property to set as scriptable

params.name: state
params.documentation: Whether to make the property scriptable (`true`) or non-scriptable (`false`)

@roblox/global/setthreadidentity.documentation: Sets the current thread's identity to the specified value.
@roblox/global/setthreadidentity.code_sample:
print("Original thread identity:", getthreadidentity())

-- Change identity to 2 (typical game script level)
setthreadidentity(2)
print("New thread identity:", getthreadidentity())

-- Change back to default identity (usually 7 for executor threads)
setthreadidentity(7)
print("Restored thread identity:", getthreadidentity())

params.name: id
params.documentation: The identity value to change to

@roblox/global/getcallingscript.documentation: Returns the script that is currently executing. For executor threads, this function returns `nil`.
@roblox/global/getcallingscript.code_sample:
-- This will return nil since it's run directly by the executor
print("Direct call:", getcallingscript())

-- Create a dummy script execution context
local bindable = Instance.new("BindableFunction")
bindable.OnInvoke = function()
	local callingScript = getcallingscript()
	return callingScript and callingScript:GetFullName() or "nil"
end

print("From bindable:", bindable:Invoke())

@roblox/global/getloadedmodules.documentation: Returns all ModuleScripts that are currently loaded in the caller's global state.
@roblox/global/getloadedmodules.code_sample:
local loadedModules = getloadedmodules()

print("Total loaded modules:", #loadedModules)

-- Print the first few modules
for i = 1, math.min(5, #loadedModules) do
	local module = loadedModules[i]
	print(i, module:GetFullName())
end

@roblox/global/getrunningscripts.documentation: Returns all the running scripts in the caller's global state. CoreScripts are filtered by default.
@roblox/global/getrunningscripts.code_sample:
local runningScripts = getrunningscripts()

-- Count scripts by type
local scriptCounts = {
	LocalScript = 0,
	ModuleScript = 0,
	Other = 0
}

for _, script in ipairs(runningScripts) do
	if script:IsA("LocalScript") then
		scriptCounts.LocalScript = scriptCounts.LocalScript + 1
	elseif script:IsA("ModuleScript") then
		scriptCounts.ModuleScript = scriptCounts.ModuleScript + 1
	else
		scriptCounts.Other = scriptCounts.Other + 1
	end
end

print("Total running scripts:", #runningScripts)
print("Running LocalScripts:", scriptCounts.LocalScript)
print("Running ModuleScripts:", scriptCounts.ModuleScript)
print("Other running scripts:", scriptCounts.Other)

@roblox/global/getscriptbytecode.documentation: Returns the bytecode of the given script. If the script has no bytecode, returns `nil`.
@roblox/global/getscriptbytecode.code_sample:
-- Find a LocalScript in the game
local function findScript()
	for _, instance in ipairs(game:GetDescendants()) do
		if instance:IsA("LocalScript") and not instance:IsA("CoreScript") then
			return instance
		end
	end
end

local script = findScript()
if script then
	local bytecode = getscriptbytecode(script)
	if bytecode then
		print("Bytecode length:", #bytecode)
		print("First 10 bytes:", string.byte(bytecode, 1, 10))
	else
		print("No bytecode available")
	end
else
	print("No suitable script found")
end

params.name: script
params.documentation: The script to retrieve bytecode from

@roblox/global/getscriptclosure.documentation: Creates a new closure (function) from the provided script's bytecode. This closure is typically used to retrieve constants.
@roblox/global/getscriptclosure.code_sample:
-- Find a LocalScript in the game
local function findScript()
	for _, instance in ipairs(game:GetDescendants()) do
		if instance:IsA("LocalScript") and not instance:IsA("CoreScript") then
			return instance
		end
	end
end

local script = findScript()
if script then
	local closure = getscriptclosure(script)
	if closure then
		print("Got script closure")
		-- Now we can inspect the closure using debug functions
		local constants = debug.getconstants(closure)
		print("Script constants:")
		for i, constant in ipairs(constants) do
			print(i, constant)
		end
	else
		print("Could not get closure")
	end
else
	print("No suitable script found")
end

params.name: script
params.documentation: The script to obtain the closure from

@roblox/global/getscripthash.documentation: Returns a SHA384 hash (in hex) of the given script's compressed and encrypted bytecode. If the script has no bytecode, returns `nil`.
@roblox/global/getscripthash.code_sample:
-- Find a LocalScript in the game
local function findScript()
	for _, instance in ipairs(game:GetDescendants()) do
		if instance:IsA("LocalScript") and not instance:IsA("CoreScript") then
			return instance
		end
	end
end

local script = findScript()
if script then
	local hash = getscripthash(script)
	if hash then
		print("Script hash:", hash)
		print("Hash length:", #hash)
	else
		print("No hash available")
	end
else
	print("No suitable script found")
end

params.name: script
params.documentation: The script to get the hash from

@roblox/global/getscripts.documentation: Returns all the scripts in the game. CoreScripts are filtered by default.
@roblox/global/getscripts.code_sample:
local scripts = getscripts()

-- Count scripts by type
local scriptCounts = {
	LocalScript = 0,
	ModuleScript = 0,
	Other = 0
}

for _, script in ipairs(scripts) do
	if script:IsA("LocalScript") then
		scriptCounts.LocalScript = scriptCounts.LocalScript + 1
	elseif script:IsA("ModuleScript") then
		scriptCounts.ModuleScript = scriptCounts.ModuleScript + 1
	else
		scriptCounts.Other = scriptCounts.Other + 1
	end
end

print("Total scripts:", #scripts)
print("LocalScripts:", scriptCounts.LocalScript)
print("ModuleScripts:", scriptCounts.ModuleScript)
print("Other scripts:", scriptCounts.Other)

@roblox/global/getsenv.documentation: Returns the environment (globals table) of the given script thread.
@roblox/global/getsenv.code_sample:
-- Find a LocalScript in the game
local function findScript()
	for _, instance in ipairs(game:GetDescendants()) do
		if instance:IsA("LocalScript") and not instance:IsA("CoreScript") then
			return instance
		end
	end
end

local script = findScript()
if script then
	local env = getsenv(script)
	print("Script environment:")
	local count = 0
	for k, v in pairs(env) do
		if type(v) ~= "function" then -- Skip functions to keep output clean
			print(k, v)
			count = count + 1
			if count >= 10 then break end -- Limit output
		end
	end
else
	print("No suitable script found")
end

params.name: script
params.documentation: The script whose environment is to be retrieved

@roblox/global/loadstring.documentation: Compiles the given Lua source into a function. The returned function is runnable and its environment becomes 'unsafe'.
@roblox/global/loadstring.code_sample:
local source = [[return function()
	print("Hello from loadstring!")
	return 42
end]]

local func, err = loadstring(source, "DynamicScript")
if func then
	local result = func()()
	print("Function returned:", result) -- Output: Function returned: 42
else
	print("Error:", err)
end

params.name: src
params.documentation: The source code to compile

params.name: chunkname
params.documentation: The name to assign to the chunk

@roblox/global/firesignal.code_sample:
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.ChildAdded:Connect(function(arg1)
    print(typeof(arg1))
end)

firesignal(part.ChildAdded) -- Output: nil
firesignal(part.ChildAdded, workspace) -- Output: Instance

params.name: signal
params.documentation: The signal to fire.
The wanted arguments to pass into the fired connections.

@roblox/global/getconnections.documentation: Returns the connections of the specified [RBXScriptSignal](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptSignal).
@roblox/global/getconnections.code_sample:
local DummyFolder = Instance.new("Folder")
DummyFolder.ChildAdded:Connect(function() return "Triggered" end)
local connection = getconnections(DummyFolder.ChildAdded)[1] -- First connection in the returned table

print(`{connection.Function()}, {type(connection.Thread)}`) -- Output: Triggered, thread

-- Example with C-Signal
local CConnection = getconnections(game.Players.LocalPlayer.Idled)[1]
print(`{CConnection.Function}, {CConnection.Thread}`) -- Output: nil, nil

params.name: signal
params.documentation: The signal whose connections you want to retrieve.

@roblox/global/replicatesignal.documentation: If possible, replicates the specified signal to the server with the provided arguments. The arguments must match the signal's expected parameters.
@roblox/global/replicatesignal.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")
local LocalPlayer = Players.LocalPlayer

-- Replicate a jump signal to the server
replicatesignal(LocalPlayer.Character.Humanoid.Jumping, true)

-- The server should now see your character jump

params.name: signal
params.documentation: The signal to replicate to the server.
The arguments to pass into the signal.

@roblox/global/WebSocket.documentation: The WebSocket type provides a simple interface for sending and receiving data over a WebSocket connection.

@roblox/global/WebSocket.connect.documentation: Establishes a WebSocket connection to the specified URL.
@roblox/global/WebSocket.connect.code_sample:
local connection = WebSocket.connect("wss://echo.websocket.org")

-- Set up message handler
connection.OnMessage:Connect(function(message)
    print("Received message:", message)
end)

-- Set up close handler
connection.OnClose:Connect(function()
    print("Connection closed")
end)

-- Send a message
connection:Send("Hello WebSocket!")

-- Wait a bit then close the connection
task.wait(5)
connection:Close()

params.name: url
params.documentation: The WebSocket URL to connect to.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.documentation: Represents a connection to a signal, allowing you to disconnect it later.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Enabled.documentation: Whether the connection can receive events.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.ForeignSta.documentation: Whether the function was connected by a foreign Lua state (i.e. `CoreScript`s, [Actor](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/classes/Actor)s).

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.LuaConnect.documentation: Whether the connection was created in Luau code.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Function.documentation: The function bound to this connection. `nil` when `ForeignState` is true, or `LuaConnection` is `false`.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Thread.documentation: The thread that created the connection. `mil` when `ForeignState` is true, or `LuaConnection` is `false`.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Fire.documentation: Fires this connection with the provided arguments.
@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Fire.code_sample:
local DummyFolder = Instance.new("Folder")
DummyFolder.ChildAdded:Connect(function(child)
    print("Child added:", child.Name)
end)

local connection = getconnections(DummyFolder.ChildAdded)[1]
local newPart = Instance.new("Part")
newPart.Name = "TestPart"

-- Fire the connection directly without actually adding the part
connection.Fire(newPart) -- Output: Child added: TestPart

params.name: self
params.documentation: The connection to fire.
The arguments to pass to the connected function.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Defer.documentation: Defers an event to connection with the provided arguments.
@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Defer.code_sample:
local DummyFolder = Instance.new("Folder")
DummyFolder.ChildAdded:Connect(function(child)
    print("Child added (deferred):", child.Name)
end)

local connection = getconnections(DummyFolder.ChildAdded)[1]
local newPart = Instance.new("Part")
newPart.Name = "TestPart"

-- Defer the event to the connection
connection.Defer(newPart) -- Output: Child added (deferred): TestPart

params.name: self
params.documentation: The connection to defer the event to.
The arguments to pass to the connected function.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Disconnect.documentation: Disconnects the connection from the function.
@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Disconnect.code_sample:
local DummyFolder = Instance.new("Folder")
DummyFolder.ChildAdded:Connect(function()
    print("Child added!")
end)

local connection = getconnections(DummyFolder.ChildAdded)[1]

-- Disconnect the connection
connection.Disconnect()

-- This won't print anything since the connection was disconnected
local newPart = Instance.new("Part")
newPart.Parent = DummyFolder

params.name: self
params.documentation: The connection to disconnect.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Disable.code_sample:
local DummyFolder = Instance.new("Folder")
DummyFolder.ChildAdded:Connect(function()
    print("Child added!")
end)

local connection = getconnections(DummyFolder.ChildAdded)[1]

-- Disable the connection
connection.Disable()

-- This won't print anything since the connection is disabled
local newPart1 = Instance.new("Part")
newPart1.Parent = DummyFolder

-- Enable the connection again
connection.Enable()

-- This will print since the connection is enabled again
local newPart2 = Instance.new("Part")
newPart2.Parent = DummyFolder -- Output: Child added!

params.name: self
params.documentation: The connection to disable.

@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Enable.documentation: Enables the connection, allowing it to fire.
@roblox/globaltype/Connection.Enable.code_sample:
local DummyFolder = Instance.new("Folder")
DummyFolder.ChildAdded:Connect(function()
    print("Child added!")
end)

local connection = getconnections(DummyFolder.ChildAdded)[1]

-- Disable the connection
connection.Disable()

-- This won't print anything
local newPart1 = Instance.new("Part")
newPart1.Parent = DummyFolder

-- Enable the connection
connection.Enable()

-- This will print since the connection is enabled
local newPart2 = Instance.new("Part")
newPart2.Parent = DummyFolder -- Output: Child added!

params.name: self
params.documentation: The connection to enable.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.documentation: Represents a connection to a WebSocket server.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.S.documentation: Sends a message over the WebSocket connection.

params.name: self
params.documentation: The WebSocket instance.

params.name: message
params.documentation: The message to send.

params.name: self
params.documentation: The WebSocket instance.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Event triggered when a message is received over the WebSocket connection.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an [RBXScriptConnection](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptConnection) that represents it.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to call when a message is received.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Connects the given function to the event and returns an [RBXScriptConnection](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptConnection) that represents it.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to call when a message is received.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Connects the given function to the event (for a single invocation) and returns an [RBXScriptConnection](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptConnection) that represents it.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to call when a message is received.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Event triggered when the WebSocket connection closes.
Connects the given function to the event and returns an [RBXScriptConnection](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptConnection) that represents it.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to call when the connection closes.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Connects the given function to the event and returns an [RBXScriptConnection](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptConnection) that represents it.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to call when the connection closes.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Connects the given function to the event (for a single invocation) and returns an [RBXScriptConnection](https://create.roblox.com/docs/reference/engine/datatypes/RBXScriptConnection) that represents it.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

params.name: func
params.documentation: The function to call when the connection closes.

@roblox/globaltype/WebSocketConnection.O.documentation: Yields the current thread until the signal fires and returns the arguments provided by the signal.

params.name: self
params.documentation: An object that runs connected functions upon a specific occurrence.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingObject.documentation: Represents a drawing object that can be used to render 2D graphics in Roblox.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingObject.Visible.documentation: Whether the drawing is visible. Defaults to `false`.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingObject.ZIndex.documentation: Determines the order in which a Drawing renders relative to others.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingObject.Transpa.documentation: The opacity of the drawing (1 - opaque, 0 - transparent).

params.name: self
params.documentation: The drawing object to destroy

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingObject.Remove.documentation: Alias for `Destroy`, removes the drawing object.

params.name: self
params.documentation: The drawing object to remove

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingLine.documentation: Renders a line starting at `From` and ending at `To`.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingLine.From.documentation: The starting point of the line.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingLine.To.documentation: The ending point of the line.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingText.documentation: Renders text at a specified position.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingText.TextBound.documentation: The size of the text when rendered. Cannot be set.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingText.Center.documentation: Whether the text should be centered horizontally.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingText.Outline.documentation: Whether the text should have be outlined.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingImage.documentation: Draws the image data to the screen. `Data` *must* be the raw image data.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingImage.Data.documentation: The raw image data of the file. You can use [readfile](https://docs.sunc.su/Filesystem/readfile/) or another method to read the raw bytecode of the image.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingCircle.documentation: Draws a circle that is centered at `Position`.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingCircle.NumSide.documentation: The number of sides of the circle.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingCircle.Positio.documentation: The center position of the circle.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingCircle.Thickne.documentation: If `Filled` is `false`, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingCircle.Filled.documentation: Whether the circle should be filled.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingSquare.documentation: Draws a rectangle starting at `Position` and ending at `Position` + `Size`.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingSquare.Positio.documentation: The top-left corner position of the square.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingSquare.Thickne.documentation: If `Filled` is `false`, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingSquare.Filled.documentation: Whether the square should be filled.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingQuad.documentation: Draws a four-sided figure connecting to each of the four points.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingQuad.Thickness.documentation: If `Filled` is `false`, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingQuad.Filled.documentation: Whether the quad should be filled.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingTriangle.documentation: Draws a triangle connecting to each of the three points.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingTriangle.Thick.documentation: If `Filled` is `false`, specifies the thickness of the outline.

@roblox/globaltype/DrawingTriangle.Fille.documentation: Whether the triangle should be filled.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.documentation: A table describing a function or stack level as returned by debug.getinfo.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.source.documentation: string â€” The name of the chunk that created the function.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.short_src.documentation: string â€” A printable version of `source` to be used in error messages.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.what.documentation: string â€” "Lua" if the function is a Luau function, or "C" if it is a C function.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.currentline.documentation: number â€” The current line where the given function is executing. When no line information is available, `currentline` is -1.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.name.documentation: string â€” The name of the function. If it cannot find a name, then `name` is a blank string.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.nups.documentation: number â€” The number of upvalues in the function.

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.numparams.documentation: number â€” The number of parameters in the function (always 0 for C functions).

@roblox/globaltype/DebugInfo.is_vararg.documentation: number â€” Whether the function has a variadic argument (1 if it does, 0 if it does not).
